dd.p: <h1> and <title> for topic; <h2> for section (Title should map to both <title> and <h1> in HDITA). Better way to say this? <figcaption> in <figure>. Title also applied to audio and video in HDITA as attribute
# or === underline for topic; ## or ----- underline for section

fig.title: XDITA example
fig.p: The following example demonstrates the use of a title in an XDITA topic.
fig.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE topic PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD LIGHTWEIGHT DITA Topic//EN" "lw-topic.dtd"> <topic id="install-and-setup"> <title>Installing and Setting up Remote Lighting</title> <shortdesc>Installation of your lighting kit includes installing the light bulbs into light fixtures, preparing the remote control, and programming lighting groups. </shortdesc> </topic>

fig.title: HDITA example
fig.p: The following example demonstrates the use of a title in an HDITA topic.
fig.pre:
Installing and Setting up Remote Lighting

Installation of your lighting kit includes installing the light bulbs into light fixtures, preparing the remote control, and programming lighting groups.

fig.title: MDITA example
fig.p: The following example demonstrates the use of a title in an MDITA topic.
fig.pre:
# Installing and Setting up Remote Lighting
Installation of your lighting kit includes installing the light bulbs into light fixtures, preparing the remote control, and programming lighting groups.
